sub_title: Wink Works for Health - Research, Projects & Training
summary:
Wink Works (=Gerda Wink & partners) provide practice-relevant research, training/education and project management. 

I work to contribute to health for all. As social entrepreneur I work with different organisations: universities (of applied sciences), knowledge institutes and regional public health services. This variety of experiences feeds back into the training I provide. It also gives me the opportunity to establish helpful connections between professionals working in research, education, policy and practice.

projects.title: Team coordination and facilitation of reflection sessions (SWOT analyses) with students and teachers on Bachelor/Master Programmes of Wageningen University
projects.description: A critical reflection chapter by students is requested as part of accreditation reports on Bachelor and Master programmes of Wageningen University. We facilitate SWOT analysis sessions with students and teachers of different Master and Bachelor programmes of Wageningen University. Resulting in a report chapter describing the most importants strenghts, weaknesses, opportunities and threats of the programmes.

profile_positions.description: Development and Impact of SameNoord, a family health neighbourhood program with parents and professionals.
profile_positions.title: Wink Works - PhD Student @AMPHI IGB and Reducing health inequities group

profile_positions.description:
Project 'Less poverty and stress, more particpation and health' (ZonMw)
- Writing research proposal with PhD students for analysis of local context in 5 collaborating municipalities (Nov. 2020)
- Guiding choice process of interventions to support people who live in poverty for a long time, through chairing meetings of the consortium and municipal workgroups (Mar. - June 2021). 
Consortium partners: people with experience of living in poverty, 5 municipalities, Impuls, WageningenUR and societal partners.
profile_positions.title: Wink Works - Reseacher/Process guidance @Impuls centrum voor maatschappelijke zorg

profile_positions.description:
Guidance of teams consisting of 5-8 MSc students with different disciplinary and cultural backgrounds in working together on real (payed) consultancy assignments, listed below (not complete):
* Economic homelessness in Amsterdam: policy analysis (May-July 2020)
* Relieving mosquito bite itch by tape (May-July '19)
* Detecting Asthma in breath (May-July '15)
* Providing training in Sierra Leone in times of Ebola (group meetings not allowed) (May-July '15)  
* Evidence and communication-theory-based written health advice (Oct.-Dec. '14 & Mar.-May '15)
* Ideas for Amsterdam as a surprisingly green city (May-July '14)
* Evidence-based nutrition information to facilitate formula choice for Chinese parents (May-July '14)
* Content for a website on WageningenUR cocoa expertise (Mar.-May '14)
* Building blocks for curriculum development of a vocational agricultural school for 12-16 year old teens in Burkina Faso (Sept.-Oct. '13)
* Prediction of health risks for adolescents in Arnhem and the role of social media (May-July '13)
* Measuring food waist in the Hospital in Ede (Mar.-May '13)
* Communication needs assessment of members of the cooperation 'Farmer & Care' (Aug.-Oct. '12)
* Exploration of possibilities for continuation of the programme 'Taste Lessons' (May-July '12). 
* Advise on improving access to health care of international students & staf of WUR (Aug.-Nov. '11).
* Acceptance of Cannabinoid based medicine (CBM) of (potential) CBM prescribers (Mar.-May '11).
* Advise on optimizing the production system of Medical Cannabis (Sep.-Nov. '10).
* High school modules for enthusiastic students choosing for Food & Health research (Apr.-Jul. '10)
* 'Zorgflorijnen'; an answer to the increasing need for care of elderly? (Apr.-Jul. '10)
* Advise on the HAN (Hogeschool Arnhem Nijmegen) minor Health Promotion (Apr.-Jul. '09)
* Succes- and failure factors of 'healthy nutrition promoting interventions' on vocational schools (VMBO-groen scholen) (Apr.-Jul. '09)
profile_positions.title: Wink Works - Coaching Academic Consultancy Training students

profile_positions.description: Facilitator of student reflection sessions on their BSc or MSc programme, resulting in a critical student reflection chapter in the programme accreditation report, as well as a SWOT meta-analysis of over 40 programme reports (Jan. 2020). Coordinator of team of four facilitators. In 2022 the team started a new round of sessions for reflection on high quality programmes, also with teachers and also serving as mid term  evaluation.
profile_positions.title: Wink Works - Facilitator & coordinator student reflection (SWOT) sessions on BSc /MSc programmes

profile_positions.description: International students and staff played a key role in the development of this movie: a student team executed the needs assessment which articulated the need for information provision. Students gave feedback on the script and raw edit of the film. (2013-2014) We updated the film (2016-2017).
profile_positions.title: Wink Works - FAIRbeeldproducties produced a movie about Health Care for international WUR students

profile_positions.description: Providing ACT teams with a workshop on Proposal Writing (on Problem & Stakeholder analysis, Logical Framework and Communication) and providing them with feedback on their project proposals.
profile_positions.title: Wink Works - Proposal Writing teacher for Academic Consultancy Training students

profile_positions.description: Becoming a Master Manager. Basing ourselves on the model of Quinn et al. (2007) we explore different roles of a manager (coach, innovator, producer, controler). We practice different management skills like bringing bad news through roleplay with fellow students as well as with professional training actors.
profile_positions.title: Wink Works - Training Management Skills

profile_positions.description: This training provides theories and tools for persuasive argumentations and plenty of possibilities to  practise and play with personal argumentation skills through speech and debate.
profile_positions.title: Wink Works - Training Argumentation Skills

profile_positions.description: Theory and practice of the basic conversation skills of Motivational Interviewing (Miller et al, 2013) in two half day training sessions.
profile_positions.title: Wink Works - Study advisors of Wageningen University: Training Motivational Interviewing

profile_positions.description: In this training we (32 students and myself as trainer) explored what skills it takes to be a consultant or to give advise. Students practised presenting by pitching about their dream consultancy, practised networking by interviewing a consultant in their field and practised dealing with resistance of a client by discussing cases. Theory from Block (Flawless Consulting; A guide to getting your expertise used, 2011) explained the expert, pair-of-hands or collaborative role of consultants and success factors and pitfalls in different phases of consultancy.
profile_positions.title: Wink Works - Training Consultancy/Advisory Skills

profile_positions.description: Development of 1) Logical Framework example of an ACT project and 2) Logical Framework step by step instruction video (with Sterrenburg Coaching). Both example and video are now part of the Proposal Writing workshop of the WUR course ACT.
profile_positions.title: Wink Works - Developing educational material (video) on making a Logical Framework

profile_positions.description: Keete Voerman (MM) & Gerda Wink (WW) jointly provided input for the development/intervision path for study advisors of Wageningen UR. We analysed and presented the variety of 'study motivation forms' currently in use and discussed quality of these forms with study advisors at two sessions in June.
profile_positions.title: Mixed Methods & Wink Works : Providing Workshops on Motivation forms for study advisors

profile_positions.description: Lecturer at the course 'Research Methodology in Social Sciences' for two groups of first year students in Social Sciences.
profile_positions.title: Wink Works - Lecturer 'Research Methodology in Social Sciences'

profile_positions.description: In the period Aug. 2015 - Jan. 2016 we developed a project plan for execution and evaluation from May 2016 - Nov. 2019. We did this in collaboration with parents living in Wijchen Noord and with local/regional health professionals and researchers. Project partners: The Municipal health service (GGD Gelderland Zuid), AMPHI Collaborative centre Public Health, Welfare organization (Meer Voormekaar), RadboudUMC, Wijchen Municipality and the Social teams. From Nov. 2019 we worked on a description of the way we realised lasting health enhancing activities. This resulted in a practical, experience and science-based handbook (Feb. 2021). We submitted the description of this way of working to the  intervention recognition committee at RIVM.
profile_positions.title: Wink Works - Project Lead 'SameNoord'

profile_positions.description: This network offers an online platform for sharing questions and answers on Research in the field of Health Promotion and Prevention. Open for (future) professionals in research, practice, policy and/or education. See TSG nr 5 / 2012 for a perspective on the first three years of this group (in Dutch): '1000e lid verwelkomd, wat levert dit netwerk op?'
profile_positions.title: Initiator & Manager LinkedIn group 'Onderzoek voor Preventie en Gezondheidsbevordering'

profile_positions.description:
'Klein maar fijn' short research projects address questions from policy and practice in regions of Gelderland. In the Academic Collaborative Centre AMPHI IGB ('Integraal Gezondheidsbeleid') professionals from the department Primary and Community care of RadboudUMC and Municipal Health Services (Nijmegen and Arnhem) collaborate in research. Two projects I guided:
* With a MSc internship student Health and Society (WUR) we executed a process evaluation of a primary school based lunch intervention of GGD Gelderland Zuid. Results: 1) an overview of strong and attention points 2) a description for the intervention database 3) effect measurement tools.
* With a MSc thesis student Health and Society (WUR), VGGM and other regions, we executed an inventory of the way General Practitioners (might) work with Youth doctors and the Youth neighbourhood team (sociaal wijkteam jeugd in Dutch) for quality (preventive) care for youth.

For summaries (Dutch) go to: https://academischewerkplaatsamphi.nl/publicaties/publicaties-integraal-gezondheidsbeleid/populair-niet-wetenschappelijk/
profile_positions.title: Wink Works - Academic Collaborative Centre AMPHI IGB: Guiding 'Klein maar fijn' research projects

profile_positions.description: Providing feedback on 'Overheerlijk Overblijven' instruction materials through a focusgroup interview with 'healthy school advisors' of GGD Gelderland Zuid.
profile_positions.title: Wink Works - Guiding Focusgroup interview on school health intervention instruction materials

profile_positions.description:
19th of April 2012, Rotterdam
More info (in Dutch): http://verenigingvenw.nl/cafelocal19april2012.htm and TSG nr 5 / 2012
profile_positions.title: Wink Works - Organizing Cafe Local Social Marketing

profile_positions.description: Lecturer/tutor at the course (1) Evidence Based Practice & Research and (2) Internship guidance of 10 students in the 3rd year of their study 'Sport, Health & Management'.
profile_positions.title: Wink Works - Lecturer/tutor

profile_positions.description: Training dietitians, physiotherapists and nurse practitioners as lifestyle consultant in the 'Beweegkuur'. The 'Beweegkuur' is a combined lifestyle intervention for overweight and obese clients with a high risk on health problems. The client is guided by a multidisciplinary team which gives attention to healthy physical activity, healthy food and changing behavior in individual and group meetings. Goal: improved health of the client. I give training on Motivational Interviewing, Multidisciplinary collaboration and the 'Beweegkuur' implementation.
profile_positions.title: Wink Works - 'Beweegkuur' Trainer Motivational Interviewing

profile_positions.description:
Giving two courses for Medical Science students:
(1) Motivating patients to healthy behavior, adressing  determinants of health and taking stages of change into account; (assessing) different types of health communication (focus on Nutrition behaviour)
(2) Primary Prevention by medical doctors by taking into account stages of changes and using Minimal intervention Strategy (focus on smoking behaviour).
profile_positions.title: Wink Works - Skills trainer

company.name: CEPHIR ‘Centre for Effective Public Health In the larger Rotterdam area’

profile_positions.company: CEPHIR ‘Centre for Effective Public Health In the larger Rotterdam area’
profile_positions.description: A pragmatic review of reviews; composition of an overview of available evidence on effects of interventions targeting multiple risk behaviors (diet, exercise or use of alcohol or tabacco). Including a description of characteristics of effective interventions or elements.
profile_positions.title: Wink Works - Research: Review of (Intervention) Reviews
